com.snap2d.gl
Class RenderControl

java.lang.Object
  com.snap2d.gl.RenderControl

public class RenderControl
extends Object

Acts as a rendering handle to a Display. This class handles the core game update/render thread.

Since:
Snapdragon2D 1.0
Author:
Brian Groenke
See Also:
Display

Constructor Detail

RenderControl

protected RenderControl(int buffs)
Creates a RenderControl object that can be used to render data to a Display. A Canvas object is created internally with a managed BufferStrategy.

Parameters:
buffs - the number of buffers the BufferStrategy should be created with.
Method Detail

startRenderLoop

public void startRenderLoop()

stopRenderLoop

public void stopRenderLoop()

setRenderActive

public void setRenderActive(boolean active)
If true, the rendering loop will actively render to the screen and execute update logic. Otherwise, the loop will sleep until it is stopped or set to active again.

Parameters:
active - true to enable active rendering/updates, false to disable rendering/updates

setUseHardwareAcceleration

public void setUseHardwareAcceleration(boolean accelerated)
Enable/disable hardware accelerated rendering of images.

Parameters:
accelerated -

dispose

public void dispose()
Fully releases system resources used by this RenderControl object and clears all registered Renderables. Note that once this method is called, the object is unusable and should be released for garbage collection. Continued use of a disposed RenderControl object will cause errors.

getCurrentFPS

public int getCurrentFPS()
Gets the last recorded number of frames rendered per second.

Returns:

getCurrentTPS

public int getCurrentTPS()
Gets the last recorded number of updates (ticks) per second.

Returns:

setTargetFPS

public void setTargetFPS(int fps)
Sets the frame rate that the rendering algorithm will target when interpolating.

Parameters:
fps - frames per second

setTargetTPS

public void setTargetTPS(int tps)
Sets the frequency per second at which the Renderable.update method is called.

Parameters:
tps - ticks per second

setMaxUpdates

public void setMaxUpdates(int maxUpdates)
Sets the max number of times updates can be issued before a render must occur. If animations are "chugging" or skipping, it may help to set this value to a very low value (0-2). Higher values will prevent the game updates from freezing.

Parameters:
maxUpdates - max number of updates to be sent before rendering.

setGamma

public void setGamma(float gamma)
Sets the gamma value that will be applied to all pixels rendered on screen.

Parameters:
gamma - a gamma value (0.0 > gamma < 1.0 = darker; gamma > 1.0 = brighter)

setGammaCorrectionEnabled

public void setGammaCorrectionEnabled(boolean enabled)

isGammaEnabled

public boolean isGammaEnabled()

isHardwareAccelerated

public boolean isHardwareAccelerated()

isActive

public boolean isActive()
Checks to see if this RenderControl has a loop that is actively rendering/updating.

Returns:
true if active, false otherwise.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Checks to see if this RenderControl has a currently running loop.

Returns:
true if a loop is running, false otherwise.

addRenderable

public void addRenderable(Renderable r,
                          int pos)
Registers the Renderable object with this RenderControl to be rendered on screen. The render() method will be called and the RenderData object used to show the image on screen.

Parameters:
r - the Renderable object to be called when rendering.
pos - the position in the rendering queue to be placed. 0 is the first to be rendered on each frame and LAST is provided as a convenience field to insert at position size - 1 (aka the end of the queue, thus last to be rendered on each frame).

removeRenderable

public void removeRenderable(Renderable r)
Removes the Renderable object from the queue, if it exists.

Parameters:
r - removes the Renderable from the queue.

getRenderQueueSize

public int getRenderQueueSize()
Fetches List.size() for the rendering queue.

Returns:

blend

protected int blend(float srcA,
                    int srcValue,
                    int dstValue)
Blends a translucent pixel with an opaque destination value. Currently unused.

Parameters:
srcA -
srcValue -
dstValue -
Returns:

render

protected void render(Renderable[] renderables,
                      float interpolation)
Internal method that is called by RenderLoop to draw rendered data to the screen. The back buffer's data is copied to the main image which, if hardware acceleration is enabled, is drawn to a VolatileImage. Otherwise, the BufferedImage itself is drawn.
